items.message: Thursday's early morning tide at 00:15 on 09/03/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather and moderate waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.49 m. The total forecast tide is 6.15 meters Chart Datum (3.10 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high tide, minimal flood impacts are expected. Waves could cause a small amount of overtopping of the beach. A small amount of water could find its way behind the beach and may pond on nearby land and fields including at Climping Street Car Park and Mill Lane.  Access could be restricted during and after high tide. Take care if visiting Climping beach. The tide levels are a little elevated over the next 2 days. Very similar conditions and flood impacts are expected on Friday's early morning tide at 01:00 10/03/2023, after which the weather improves. Where flood impacts do occurâ€š they will be very minor. We continue to monitor the forecast and routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. We will update this message by 11:00 on 09/03/2023.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.60mAOD at 03:30 on 09/03/23.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 44 cubic metres per second and is rising. We anticipate the flows to increase to normal over the next two days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 10:00 on 09/03/23 or as the situation changes.

A large tidal surge is expected to overtop sea defences as a result of spring tides.  The next two sets of tides are predicted to be high. Forecast high water is 21:00 on 08/03/2023 with a level of 1.31 mAOD and a Force 3 westerly wind. Forecast high water is 10:30 on 09/03/2023 with a level of 1.34 mAOD and a Force 4 south westerly wind. All times are local and refer to the high water time at Christchurch, mAOD is height above average sea level for more detail refer to local tide tables. Flooding to roads and farmland//properties is possible//forecast at these times, however conditions may apply one/two to two/four hours either side of the high tide.  We expect flooding to affect Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon   

We are closely monitoring the situation.   
Please be careful along beaches, promenades and coastal footpaths and roads.  
This message will be updated Thursday the 9th March 2023 or as the situation changes.

Thursday's early morning tide at 00:21 on 09/03/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with light Easterly Force 2 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.62 m. The total forecast tide is 5.25 metres Chart Datum (2.52 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 1 hour either side of high water, levels will be high at South Street and Queen Street Emsworth. The Ship Inn car park at Langstone will flood. Water will flow into the road at Langstone High Street, although flood depths will be relatively shallow, and flooding will only cause impacts nearest to the harbour front. High tide at 12:27 on Thursday 09/03/2023 is unlikely to cause impacts. At 00:51 on Friday 10/03/2023 the tide and flood impacts should be slightly increased. We will issue further advice. In Emsworth, we will lower levels in the Mill Pond. If you have it, and live directly on the harbour front, please install flood protection 1 hour before high tide. We will update this message by 09:00 on 09/03/2023.

Wednesday evening's tide at 23:47 on 08/03/2023 and 02:07 on 09/03/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with light Easterly Force 1 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.69 m. The total forecast tide is 4.20 metres Chart Datum (2.20 mAOD) at Beaulieu. For 30 minutes either side of high water, the tide will flood into the garden of the mill house on the downstream side of the Mill Pond. Minor road flooding at Palace Lane is also expected, making access to the village temporarily more difficult. High tide at 11:57 on Thursday 09/03/2023 is unlikely to cause impacts. At 00:18 on Friday 10/03/2023 the tide and flood impacts should be slightly increased. We will issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast. For safety, please take care if walking or driving through Beaulieu. The incoming tide will flood the main road quickly. We will update this message by 09:00 on 09/03/2023.
